result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) and OWI (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) and the other charge, OWI (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Keith D. McEvoy was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
in Wisconsin State Prison System consecutive - IMPOSED AND STAYED.
Consecutive to: any other sentence previously imposed
shall be installed on any motor vehicle owned and/or operated by defendant.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay fine, costs and DNA surcharge within 60 days (3/7/16) through the Dodge County Clerk of Courts office or establish a payment plan within said time.
Defendant shall submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.

Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license.

Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.  Defendant shall successfully attend an OWI Victim Impact Panel within 120 days of conviction.

timeConds.notes:
in Dodge County Jail with Huber and Transfer to commence forthwith.
Consecutive to: any other sentence previously imposed

Defendant Keith D. McEvoy in court with attorney Jennifer Lynn Weber.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Preliminary hearing on February 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant, Keith D. McEvoy in court, James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  His attorney, Jennifer Weber, is unavailable today and tomorrow.  Private counsel.  PE to be rescheduled. Attorney to file a retainer.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without permission from this Court.  Restrictions on travel: May not leave State of Wisconsin while case is pending.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

(12:52) Defendant Keith D. McEvoy in custody via video with attorney Greg E. Vollan (not determined yet).  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Address and DOB correct; Court finds probable cause. State requests high cash bail, prison case, $100,000 Cash w/conditions; Prelim requested within time limits. Prelim 2/5/15 at 8:30am & Review 2/4/15 at 8:15am in Br. 4; Court sets $10,000 CASH Bond with conditions:  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without permission from this Court.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Restrictions on travel: May not leave State of WI while case is pending.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.
